text: Kiev hasn't seen scenes like this since
the February revolution that drove
President Viktor Yanukovych the former
leader from power and brought the new
government to power and as you can see
there are burning tires here the plumes
of black smoke so very dark scene here
and on the other side of the barricades
we are told there's an attempt to clear
the protesters these activists from the
square who have been here ever since the
Revolution in fact since November but
there is a feeling here in Kiev the
majority of people that I've talked to
have said that they want these activists
to leave they say the people it's time
for them to go for those that want to
defend Ukraine they should go to the
frontline on the east and if you can see
over here we have the activists who tell
us that they are not going anywhere they
say they have to be here to defend Kiev
to keep an eye on the government and as
you can tell there in balaclavas and
masks many of them in camouflage with
weapons we don't see any automatic
weapons but there seem to be a lot of
sticks and pulls and they say that no
matter what happens they are not going
anywhere
so the question is how this situation
will develop
